unnormalised: So, someone asked about the best time to visit India for festivals. Honestly, it depends on what you want to experience. If you are into colours and vibrant celebrations, Holi, which usually falls around March (dates change yearly as per the Hindu calendar, this year it was on 25/03/2024), is a must. But be warned, it gets very crowded and can be quite intense, especially in places like Mathura and Vrindavan.

unnormalised: Then there's Diwali, the festival of lights. This usually falls sometime between Oct end and Nov mid. This year it will be around 31/10/2024. The entire country is lit up with diyas and fairy lights, and the atmosphere is just magical. Plus, you get to enjoy all the delicious sweets! Navratri, a 9-night festival dedicated to Goddess Durga, is also a great time, especially if you enjoy Garba and Dandiya. It is usually around September-October.
